description: The virtual machines trend dashboard displaying resources usage measurements over time - Disk I/O rates, CPU, memory, and network Tx/Rx

panels.content: ###### This dashboard displays resource usage (CPU, memory, network Tx/Rx, disk I/O) for a selected virtual machine over a selected period.

panels.description: This report displays average disk read and write rates for a selected virtual machine over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VMs Disk Read_Rate, Write_Rate Usage
-- over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS disk_name,
    AVG ( Read_Rate ) AS "Read Rate",
    AVG ( Write_Rate ) AS "Write Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN vm_disk_name
                ELSE vm_disk_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS disk_name,
            history_datetime AS Time,
            MAX ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( read_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric / ( 1024 * 1024 ), 1 ) ) AS Read_Rate,
            MAX ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( write_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric / ( 1024 * 1024 ), 1 ) ) AS Write_Rate
        FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples AS statistics
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                        statistics.vm_disk_id
                    )
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we filter by the latest vms_disks  configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks AS a
                        GROUP BY a.vm_disk_id
                    )
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.vm_disk_id
                        FROM 
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples AS b
                            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks AS c
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        c.vm_disk_id = 
                                        b.vm_disk_id
                                    )
                            WHERE
                                -- Here we filter by active vms disks only
                                b.vm_disk_status = 1
                                AND c.vm_disk_id 
                                    IN 
                                        (
                                            SELECT device_id
                                            FROM 
                                                v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                                INNER JOIN 
                                                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples AS samples
                                                    ON
                                                        (
                                                            samples.vm_configuration_version =
                                                            v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_configuration_version
                                                        )
                                            WHERE
                                                -- Here we filter by active vms only
                                                samples.vm_status = 1
                                                -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                                                AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                                                AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                                AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                                -- Here we get the latest vm_devices configuration
                                                AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id 
                                                    IN 
                                                        (
                                                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices a
                                                            GROUP BY a.vm_id, a.device_id
                                                        )
                                                -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                                                AND
                                                    CASE
                                                        WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                            THEN 1=1
                                                        WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                            THEN delete_date isnull
                                                    END
                                        )
                                AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                -- Here we get the latest vm_disks configuration
                                AND c.history_id 
                                    IN 
                                        (
                                            SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                            FROM  v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks AS d
                                            GROUP BY d.vm_disk_id
                                        )
                                -- Here we get or remove deleted VM disks according to what the user chose
                                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                                AND
                                    CASE
                                        WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                            THEN 1=1
                                        WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                            THEN delete_date isnull
                                    END
                            GROUP BY c.vm_disk_id
                            -- Here we sort by the disks that have the max read and write rate.
                            ORDER BY 
                                MAX ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( b.read_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric, 1 ) ) +
                                MAX ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( b.write_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric, 1 ) ) 
                                DESC
                            LIMIT 5
                    )
                -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
        statistics.vm_disk_id,
        disk_name, history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY all_sub_queries.time, disk_name
ORDER BY
    all_sub_queries.time,
    COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' )

-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VMs Disk Read_Rate, Write_Rate Usage
-- over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS disk_name,
    AVG ( Read_Rate ) AS "Read Rate",
    AVG ( Write_Rate ) AS "Write Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN vm_disk_name
                ELSE vm_disk_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS disk_name,
            history_datetime AS Time,
            MAX ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( read_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric / ( 1024 * 1024 ), 1 ) ) AS Read_Rate,
            MAX ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( write_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric / ( 1024 * 1024 ), 1 ) ) AS Write_Rate
        FROM 
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, read_rate_bytes_per_second, write_rate_bytes_per_second 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, read_rate_bytes_per_second, write_rate_bytes_per_second 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                        statistics.vm_disk_id
                    )
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we filter by the latest vms_disks  configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks AS a
                        GROUP BY a.vm_disk_id
                    )
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.vm_disk_id
                        FROM 
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, vm_disk_status, read_rate_bytes_per_second, write_rate_bytes_per_second 
                                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly 
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, vm_disk_status, read_rate_bytes_per_second, write_rate_bytes_per_second
                                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_daily
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks AS c
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        c.vm_disk_id = 
                                        b.vm_disk_id
                                    )
                            WHERE
                                -- Here we filter by active vms disks only
                                b.vm_disk_status = 1
                                AND c.vm_disk_id 
                                    IN 
                                        (
                                            SELECT device_id
                                            FROM 
                                                v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                                INNER JOIN 
                                                (
                                                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status
                                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                    UNION
                                                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status
                                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                                                ) AS hourly_daily
                                                    ON
                                                        (
                                                            hourly_daily.vm_configuration_version =
                                                            v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_configuration_version
                                                        )
                                            WHERE
                                                -- Here we filter by active vms only
                                                hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                                                -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                                                AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                                                AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                                AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                                -- Here we get the latest vm_devices configuration
                                                AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id 
                                                    IN 
                                                        (
                                                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices a
                                                            GROUP BY a.vm_id, a.device_id
                                                        )
                                                -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                                                AND
                                                    CASE
                                                        WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                            THEN 1=1
                                                        WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                            THEN delete_date isnull
                                                    END
                                        )
                                AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                -- Here we get the latest vm_disks configuration
                                AND c.history_id 
                                    IN 
                                        (
                                            SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                            FROM  v4_3_configuration_history_vms_disks AS d
                                            GROUP BY d.vm_disk_id
                                        )
                                -- Here we get or remove deleted VM disks according to what the user chose
                                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                                AND
                                    CASE
                                        WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                            THEN 1=1
                                        WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                            THEN delete_date isnull
                                    END
                            GROUP BY c.vm_disk_id
                            -- Here we sort by the disks that have the max read and write rate.
                            ORDER BY 
                                MAX ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( b.read_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric, 1 ) ) +
                                MAX ( ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( b.write_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric, 1 ) ) 
                                DESC
                            LIMIT 5
                    )
                -- Here we get or remove deleted entities according to what the user chose
                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
        statistics.vm_disk_id,
        disk_name, history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY all_sub_queries.time, disk_name
ORDER BY
    all_sub_queries.time,
    COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' )

panels.title: Disk I/O Rates (over time) (BR10A)

panels.description: This report displays for the top 3 most utilized network interfaces the average transmit and receive rates for a selected virtual machine over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR10A - This query returns the
--  VMs Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates
-- over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- using the samples and hourly tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS interface_name,
    AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS "Rx. Rate",
    AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS "Tx. Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
                ELSE v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Rx_rate,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM 
            v4_3_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_samples AS statistics
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces
            ON 
                (
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id =
                    statistics.vm_interface_id
                )
        WHERE 
            history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest vm_interfaces configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.vm_interface_id
                    )
            -- Here we get or remove deleted vm_interfaces according to what the user chose
            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN delete_date isnull
                END
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.vm_interface_id
                        FROM     
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_samples AS b
                            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS c
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        c.vm_interface_id = 
                                        b.vm_interface_id
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples AS d
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        d.vm_configuration_version =
                                        c.vm_configuration_version
                                        AND d.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active vms only
                            d.vm_status = 1
                            -- Here we filter by the VM chosen by the user
                            AND c.vm_interface_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT device_id
                                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                        WHERE 
                                            vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                                            AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                            AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                            -- Here we get the latest vm_devices configuration
                                            AND history_id 
                                                IN 
                                                    (
                                                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices AS a
                                                        GROUP BY a.vm_id, a.device_id
                                                    )
                                            -- Here we get or remove deleted VMs according to what the user chose
                                            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                                            AND
                                                CASE
                                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                        THEN 1=1
                                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                        THEN delete_date isnull
                                                END
                                    )
                            AND b.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                            AND b.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.vm_interface_id
                                    )
                            -- Here we get or remove deleted vm_interfaces according to what the user chose
                            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                            AND
                                CASE
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                        THEN 1=1
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                        THEN delete_date isnull
                                END
                        GROUP BY c.vm_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                            AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                            AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                            DESC
                        LIMIT 3
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY all_sub_queries.time, interface_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

-- BR10A - This query returns the
--  VMs Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates
-- over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS interface_name,
    AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS "Rx. Rate",
    AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS "Tx. Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
                ELSE v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Rx_rate,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM 
            (    
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces
            ON 
                (
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id =
                    statistics.vm_interface_id
                )
        WHERE 
            history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest vm_interfaces configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.vm_interface_id
                    )
            -- Here we get or remove deleted vm_interfaces according to what the user chose
            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN delete_date isnull
                END
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.vm_interface_id
                        FROM     
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS c
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        c.vm_interface_id = 
                                        b.vm_interface_id
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status 
                                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly 
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status
                                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                            ) AS d
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        d.vm_configuration_version =
                                        c.vm_configuration_version
                                        AND d.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active vms only
                            d.vm_status = 1
                            -- Here we filter by the VM chosen by the user
                            AND c.vm_interface_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT device_id
                                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                        WHERE 
                                            vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                                            AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                            AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                            -- Here we get the latest vm_devices configuration
                                            AND history_id 
                                                IN 
                                                    (
                                                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_devices AS a
                                                        GROUP BY a.vm_id, a.device_id
                                                    )
                                            -- Here we get or remove deleted VMs according to what the user chose
                                            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                                            AND
                                                CASE
                                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                        THEN 1=1
                                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                        THEN delete_date isnull
                                                END
                                    )
                            AND b.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                            AND b.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.vm_interface_id
                                    )
                            -- Here we get or remove deleted vm_interfaces according to what the user chose
                            -- in the "show_deleted" parameter.
                            AND
                                CASE
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                        THEN 1=1
                                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                        THEN delete_date isnull
                                END
                        GROUP BY c.vm_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                            AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                            AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                            DESC
                        LIMIT 3
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY all_sub_queries.time, interface_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

panels.title: Top 3 Most Utilized Network Interfaces Tx and Rx Rates (over time) (BR10A)

panels.description: This report displays average memory usage and peaks for a selected virtual machine over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VMs memory usage over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT
    $__time(time),
    MEM_Usage AS "Memory Usage"
FROM 
    (
        -- VMs Max and Average MEMory Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage
        FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples AS samples
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active vms only
            samples.vm_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
            AND samples.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY time, MEM_Usage
ORDER BY time

-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VMs max and Average memory usage peaks
-- over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT
    $__time(time),
    MEM_Usage AS "Memory Usage",
    MEM_Peak AS "Memory Peak"
FROM 
    (
        -- VMs Max and Average MEMory Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_memory_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Peak
        FROM
            ( 
                    SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_memory_usage, vm_status, vm_id
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_memory_usage, vm_status, vm_id
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active vms only
            hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY time, MEM_Usage, MEM_Peak
ORDER BY time

panels.title: Average Memory Usage and Peaks (over time) (BR10A)

panels.description: This report displays average CPU usage and peaks for a selected virtual machine over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VMs CPU usage over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT
    $__time(time),
    CPU_Usage AS "CPU Usage"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the vms Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage
        FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples AS samples
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active vms only
            samples.vm_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
            AND samples.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY time, CPU_Usage
ORDER BY time

-- BR10A - This query returns the
-- VMs max and average CPU usage peaks
-- over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT
    $__time(time),
    CPU_Usage AS "CPU Usage",
    CPU_Peak AS "CPU Peak"
FROM 
    (
        -- Here we get the vms Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_cpu_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Peak
        FROM 
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_cpu_usage, vm_status, vm_id
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_cpu_usage, vm_status, vm_id
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
            ) AS hourly_daily
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active vms only
            hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY time, CPU_Usage, CPU_Peak
ORDER BY time

panels.title: Average CPU Usage and Peaks (over time) (BR10A)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN datacenter_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				) 	 			AND datacenter_id  	         			    IN 			     				    ( 					 						SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters 					 						WHERE  					     						    cluster_id 					         						        IN 					             						            ( 									 										SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms  								 									) 					) 	 			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                END
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN datacenter_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				) 	 			AND datacenter_id  	         			    IN 			     				    ( 					 						SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters 					 						WHERE  					     						    cluster_id 					         						        IN 					             						            ( 									 										SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms  								 									) 					) 	 			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                END

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT        CAST ( cluster_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  	CASE      	    WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     		    THEN cluster_name 	 		WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      		    THEN cluster_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  	END AS __text  	FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters  	WHERE       	    history_id           		    IN               			    (  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters a  		         					GROUP BY a.cluster_id 	         				) 	 		AND cluster_id  		    IN 			     			    ( 					 					SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 					 					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms 				 				) 		AND 	    		    CASE  	        			    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            				    THEN 1=1 		    				WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        				    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date ISNULL 	    			END     		AND datacenter_id IN ('$datacenter_id')

list.query: SELECT DISTINCT        CAST ( cluster_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  	CASE      	    WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     		    THEN cluster_name 	 		WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      		    THEN cluster_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  	END AS __text  	FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters  	WHERE       	    history_id           		    IN               			    (  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters a  		         					GROUP BY a.cluster_id 	         				) 	 		AND cluster_id  		    IN 			     			    ( 					 					SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 					 					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms 				 				) 		AND 	    		    CASE  	        			    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            				    THEN 1=1 		    				WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        				    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date ISNULL 	    			END     		AND datacenter_id IN ('$datacenter_id')

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT        CAST ( vm_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  	CASE      	    WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     		    THEN vm_name 	 		WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      		    THEN vm_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  	END AS __text  	FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms  	WHERE       	    history_id           		    IN               			    (  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a  		         					GROUP BY a.vm_id 	         				) 	 		AND 	    		    CASE  	        			    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            				    THEN 1=1 		    				WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        				    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date ISNULL 	    			END     		AND cluster_id IN ('$cluster_id')
